intro: Racosperma hemignostum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattle, is a perennial shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are typical of the legume family. Racosperma hemignostum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and resilient species.
